reason: Bitcoin has shown strong resilience, shaking off an early decline and returning to $70,000, supported by renewed institutional bullish outlooks (Bernstein). However, significant selling pressure from miners redirecting funds to AI, alongside the debunking of major government buying rumors, introduces short-term volatility and potential headwinds, warranting a cautious 'WATCH' approach to ascertain directional clarity.
headlines: Bitcoin shakes off early decline, returns to $70,000 as Bernstein reiterates $150,000 outlook
Cipher Mining and TeraWulf are buys, MARA a sell, as Morgan Stanley begins bitcoin miner coverage
U.S. government isn't poised to sweep in with bitcoin buys, despite Jim Cramer rumor
MegaETH debuts mainnet as Ethereum scaling debate heats up
Bitcoin miner Cango sold $305 million of BTC during market slump to fund AI shift
